profiles.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
clues: German composer from the late 18th and early 19th centuries
Famous for his nine symphonies, with the final one featuring the 'Ode to Joy'
Despite becoming completely deaf, continued to compose masterpieces
Revolutionary figure in the transition from Classical to Romantic music
His Fifth Symphony opens with the famous 'ta-ta-ta-taaa' motif
Born in Bonn and later moved to Vienna where he spent most of his life
Composed the Moonlight Sonata, one of the most famous piano pieces
His Ninth Symphony was the first to incorporate a full chorus and vocal soloists
Known for his passionate and dramatic compositions
His deafness was caused by a medical condition that began in his late twenties
Composed over 200 works including symphonies, concertos, and chamber music
His hearing loss did not prevent him from achieving his greatest works
The famous 'Heiligenstadt Testament' was written during his struggle with deafness
His works were dedicated to various nobility and patrons
Bridged the gap between the Classical and Romantic periods in classical music
His funeral was attended by thousands of people in Vienna
Created some of the most emotionally powerful music ever written
His sketches and notes show the detailed process of his compositions
Influenced countless composers who came after him
His legacy continues to be celebrated in concert halls worldwide

profiles.name: The Beatles
clues: British rock band formed in Liverpool in 1960
Consisted of four members who became some of the most famous musicians in history
Their album 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band' revolutionized pop music
Known for constantly experimenting with new recording techniques and sounds
Broke up in 1970 after a decade of incredible success
Released 'Abbey Road' which featured a famous zebra crossing on its cover
Their album 'The White Album' is one of the best-selling albums of all time
Performed on the 'Ed Sullivan Show' in 1964 to a record-breaking television audience
Two of their members continued solo careers and were tragically murdered
Their music influenced an entire generation and beyond
Created innovative music videos that helped establish the format
Their early style was influenced by American rock and roll and R&B
Later albums featured orchestral arrangements and avant-garde techniques
Won multiple Grammy Awards during their career
Their song catalog is one of the most valuable in music history
The band's internal creative tensions eventually led to their breakup
Performed at the 1969 Woodstock Festival before their official breakup
Their acoustic recordings remain some of the most beloved songs ever
The group revolutionized the concept of the rock album as an art form
Their influence on music, fashion, and culture is immeasurable

profiles.name: Aretha Franklin
clues: American soul and R&B singer known as the 'Queen of Soul'
Her powerful voice and emotional delivery influenced generations of artists
Born in Memphis, Tennessee and raised in Detroit, Michigan
Father was a famous gospel preacher which influenced her early music
Hit songs include 'Respect', 'Think', and 'I Say a Little Prayer'
Known for her incredible ability to convey emotion through her singing
Won 18 Grammy Awards throughout her legendary career
Her rendition of 'Respect' became an anthem for women's rights
Recorded music across multiple decades from the 1960s onwards
Known for her powerful vocal range and improvisation skills
Performed at the inauguration of President Barack Obama
Started singing gospel music as a child in her father's church
Her album 'I Never Loved a Man the Way I Love You' launched her career
Collaborated with many famous musicians throughout her career
Her music blended soul, gospel, R&B, and pop influences
Known for her distinctive style and commanding stage presence
Her songs continue to be covered by artists of various genres
Faced personal challenges throughout her life but used them in her art
Regarded as one of the most important figures in American music history
Her legacy influenced countless soul and R&B artists who followed

profiles.name: Jazz Music
clues: An American musical genre that originated in New Orleans in the early 20th century
Combines elements of African rhythms, European harmony, and blues
Characterized by improvisation, complex harmonies, and syncopated rhythms
Evolved from ragtime, blues, and European classical music influences
Features instruments like trumpet, saxophone, trombone, piano, and double bass
Known for musicians playing off each other in a conversational style
Gained popularity in speakeasies during the Prohibition era
Spread globally and influenced music, fashion, and culture worldwide
Key figures include Louis Armstrong, Duke Ellington, and Charlie Parker
Free improvisation is central to the genre's identity and appeal
Created distinct subgenres including bebop, cool jazz, and modal jazz
Musicians often communicate through their instruments during performances
The genre values individual expression and creative freedom
Developed standards that are performed and reinterpreted by countless artists
Known for live performances that are never the same twice
Influenced the development of rock, funk, and hip-hop music
Features complex chord progressions and sophisticated musical structures
Represents a uniquely American contribution to world music culture
Continues to evolve with modern artists experimenting with fusion styles
Celebrated in festivals and concert halls around the world

profiles.name: David Bowie
clues: British rock musician and cultural icon known for constant reinvention
Famous for his androgynous style and theatrical performances
Created the alter ego Ziggy Stardust in the early 1970s
His album 'The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars' was revolutionary
Known for collaborating with other famous artists and producers
Hit songs include 'Space Oddity', 'Heroes', and 'Let's Dance'
His career spanned five decades with continual evolution and experimentation
Died in January 2016 after a private battle with cancer
Released his final album 'Blackstar' on his birthday, just two days before his death
Influenced fashion as much as he influenced music
Known for his striking appearance and innovative music videos
Worked extensively in film, acting in movies and creating soundtracks
His album 'Hunky Dory' featured timeless classics like 'Changes'
Pioneered electronic and synthesizer-based rock music
Collaborated with Brian Eno on several groundbreaking albums
His performances were theatrical productions, not just concerts
Known for his distinctive vocal range and experimental approach
Helped establish the concept of rock as artistic and challenging medium
His influence on music, fashion, and culture remains profound
Often cited as one of the greatest artists of the 20th century
